intro: Begonia zobiaensis, commonly known as the Zobia begonia, is a striking tropical plant native to the forests of Nigeria. It is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from red to pink, often with intricate patterns on the petals. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and a deep green hue. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its unique appearance and limited natural habitat, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
